subject: Philosophy
title: Voluntary Discomfort
description: A quick, practical guide to Voluntary Discomfort.

hook.text: Seneca regularly slept on a hard floor and ate simple food â€” despite being fantastically wealthy.

buildup.text: He called it practicing poverty. Not punishment, but preparation for when fortune turns.

discovery.text: By choosing discomfort voluntarily, you prove to yourself that you can handle it.

twist.text: Modern equivalents: cold showers, fasting, digital detoxes. The principle is ancient, the methods update.

climax.text: Comfort makes you fragile. Occasional discomfort keeps you resilient and grateful.

punchline.text: Choose hard things before hard things choose you.

quiz.question: Why did Seneca practice voluntary discomfort?
options: To build resilience and prepare for misfortune
